learnings.title: CTA 'Get Started' intent
learnings.pattern: 'Get Started' should go to signup (?signup=true), not login. New users expect to create account.

learnings.title: Use sportConfig for all sport-specific data
learnings.pattern: Never hardcode positions, stats, or features. Always use sportConfig.ts which handles all sports dynamically.

learnings.title: UserRole uses Capital case
learnings.pattern: All UserRole values start with capital letter: 'Coach' | 'Parent' | 'Fan' | 'SuperAdmin' | etc.

learnings.title: AuthContext provides real-time data
learnings.pattern: Never re-fetch user, userData, or teamData - AuthContext has real-time listeners. Use the hook values directly.
learnings.example: const { user, userData, teamData } = useAuth(); // Already real-time

learnings.title: Firestore helper functions in rules
learnings.pattern: Use isAuthenticated(), isCoach(), isAdmin(), isLeagueOwner(), isTeamCoach(teamId) in firestore.rules.

learnings.title: Lazy loading with retry
learnings.pattern: Use lazyWithRetry() from App.tsx for all lazy-loaded components. Handles chunk load errors automatically.

learnings.title: Firestore compound index requirement
learnings.pattern: When using multiple where() with different operators + orderBy(), create composite index in firestore.indexes.json.
learnings.example: query(collection, where('teamId', '==', x), where('date', '>=', y), orderBy('date'))

learnings.title: Component imports from OSYSComponents
learnings.pattern: Always import UI primitives from OSYSComponents.tsx and forms from OSYSFormElements.tsx.
